intro: Maximilianea gossypium, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of white, yellow, and orange. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in drought conditions, and its leaves are typically narrow and succulent. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its ability to bloom in late spring or early summer. The flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological importance in desert ecosystems.
